content: I would endeavour to improve the explanation of how the hex digit represents 4 pixels, simply: the four bits of the hex digit represent each pixel, would be enough. or a simple example of one digit

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy to understand and solve

It can be solved relatively quickly if the player is familiar with the conversion between hexadecimal and binary and the replacement of certain characters in a string

I like it very much and want to approve it.
It was a challenge and a pleasure to solve.

However that link you reference is not a good link.
Can you fix that ??
(Or if need be, just remove that.)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Love it ! :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: So excellent !

Please add sufficiently clear explanation of the requirement in the statement. Reference: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines
General Guideline 2: The description must be clear and unambiguous
CoC Guideline 3: CoC statements should be self-sufficient.

Please also follow the example in the contribution guidelines to present the Input and Output sections properly:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines

Thanks for your -too- quick review.
I hope to have fixed most of the issues.

The link is intend to be for reference only, and could be copied/pasted by the old nerds like me.
I didn't find a way to create a real link in the statement...
Thanks for the approval. At that time, I really learned hexa and binary coding myself with this function !

Right, I get that.
But when I copy and paste it into my browser, its a bad URL.

UPDATE: actually it's fine without the "cf." at the start, which I should have tried before commenting ;)

But what is that "cf." part for?

I'm glad you got approved.  Congratulations :)
"cf." stands for "confer" in french (or latin), meaning "see". Sorry for my poor english. I rephrase it.

I'm sorry about being too quick.

The constraint looks like an explanation to me. Should it be moved to the Goal section?
